questions.question: What is JavaScript?
choices: A programming language primarily used for styling web pages.
A scripting language used for creating dynamic web content.
A markup language for structuring web pages.

questions.question: Which keyword is used to declare a JavaScript variable?

What is the output of the following code?

console.log(typeof "Hello, world!");
Which of the following is NOT a JavaScript data type?
What is the result of the expression 3 + 2 + "7"?
What is the correct syntax for a single-line comment in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the parseInt() function in JavaScript?
choices: To convert a string to an integer
To round a number to the nearest integer
To determine the length of a string

questions.question: What is the correct way to write an if statement in JavaScript?
Which operator is used for strict equality comparison in JavaScript?
What does the console.log() function do in JavaScript?
choices: It prints text to the console for debugging purposes.
It displays an alert box with a message.
It opens the browser's developer tools.
